t: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David the servant of the Lord.
An*pn oracle within my heart concerning the transgression of the wicked: There*ild is*i no fear of God before his eyes.
For*ld he flatters himself in his own eyes, When*ld he finds out his iniquity and*i when he hates.
The*ld words of his mouth are*i wickedness and deceit; He*ld has ceased to be wise and*i to do good.
He*ld devises wickedness on his bed; He*ld sets himself in a way that*i is*i not good; He*ld does not abhor evil.
Your*ln mercy, O Lord,*s is*i in the heavens; Your*ld faithfulness reaches*i to the clouds.
Your*ld righteousness is*i like the great mountains; Your*ld judgments are*i a great deep; O*ld Lord,*s You preserve man and beast.
How*ln precious is*i Your lovingkindness, O God! Therefore*ld the children of men put their trust under the shadow of Your wings.
They*ld are abundantly satisfied with the fullness of Your house, And*ld You give them drink from the river of Your pleasures.
For*ld with You is*i the fountain of life; In*ld Your light we see light.
Oh,*ln continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You, And*ld Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
Let*ld not the foot of pride come against me, And*ld let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.
There*ld the workers of iniquity have fallen; They*ld have been cast down and are not able to rise.
